result.execSummary:
The defendant Dragan Pavlovic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve ONE HUNDRED (100) DAYS in the Wisconsin State Prison System, CONCURRENT TO 14CF4164.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

miscConds.notes:
* Restitution payable to MICHAEL B for ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($150.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Restitution payable to GREGORY and KAREN P for ONE THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED FIFTEEN DOLLARS AND FIFTY CENTS ($1,215.50) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered with tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.

* Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

* Defendant to participate with the Milwaukee County Day Reporting Center.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Use a physician disclosure form.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes: * Court ordered the defendant to serve SIXTY (60) DAYS in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  Huber for treatment,  Court did not oppose Electronic Monitoring for treatment and work release subject to DOC approval and Day Reporting Center approval.

* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.  Huber for treatment,  Court did not oppose Electronic Monitoring for treatment and work release subject to DOC approval and Day Reporting Center approval.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dragan Pavlovic

records.addlTxt: DISCHARGE - Regular.  Filed, sdg.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dragan Pavlovic in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Vicki Bwick appeared on behalf of the DOC.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Agent Bewick advised that Defendant is COMPLIANT with the Probation conditions.  If there are any further issues Agent Bwick will contact the Clerk.
Corrected assessment report with count 1 costs set as DOC/COLLECT
Associated with Charge #1

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve ONE HUNDRED (100) DAYS in the Wisconsin State Prison System, CONCURRENT TO 14CF4164.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWO (2) YEARS, with credit for ZERO (0) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is TWELVE (12) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWELVE (12) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of TWO (2) YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve SIXTY (60) DAYS in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  Huber for treatment,  Court did not oppose Electronic Monitoring for treatment and work release subject to DOC approval and Day Reporting Center approval.
* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.  Huber for treatment,  Court did not oppose Electronic Monitoring for treatment and work release subject to DOC approval and Day Reporting Center approval.
* Defendant to participate with the Milwaukee County Day Reporting Center.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Use a physician disclosure form.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Restitution payable to MICHAEL B for ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($150.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Restitution payable to GREGORY and KAREN P for ONE THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED FIFTEEN DOLLARS AND FIFTY CENTS ($1,215.50) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered with tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Dragan Pavlovic in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

AS TO COUNT 1 & 2:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
